description: The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC), recognizes the importance of Indigenous inmates and Indigenous programming in maintaining a safe and positive environment in its institutions. The purpose of this ACAN is to engage an external service, a Elder, to provide spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous offenders. The services provided by the Elder will be to assist Indigenous offenders, their traditional healing journey to develop understanding of traditional Indigenous culture. The selected contractor will be provide spiritual and cultural services and teachings to Indigenous offenders. The contractor will also provide guidance to staff and offenders on the protocols surrounding the use, disposal, and searching traditional medicine and spiritual items. One of the specific objective of this contract is to provide hands on support for Indigenous offender participation in group sessions.  The contractor will be required to participate in case conferences as requested. The contractor will also provide information regarding the offender's participation in a healing path and updates verbally or in writing to the Case Management team. The expected results of this contract will be to provide Indigenous programs and Elder services to offenders. The deadline for submission of a Statement of Capabilities (SEC) is March 10th, 2023, at 2:00 PM Eastern Time (ET).

# **Government Tender Announcement**

## **Elder Services Description**

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking a qualified supplier to provide Elder services to Indigenous offenders. The supplier will be responsible for delivering spiritual and cultural services, teachings, and activities to assist Indigenous offenders in their traditional healing journey.

### **Key Responsibilities**

* Provide ceremonial and spiritual services to Indigenous offenders, including counseling, teachings, and ceremonial services
* Provide advice and guidance to staff and management on issues related to Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices
* Participate in case conferences and provide information on offender participation in healing paths
* Report monthly to the Technical Authority on tasks completed and hours worked

### **Requirements**

* The supplier must be recognized by their community as an Elder/Cultural Advisor
* A minimum of five years of experience delivering spiritual and cultural services and teachings to Indigenous people, including counseling and conducting ceremonies
* Familiarity with traditional medicines and spiritual effects and the protocols surrounding their use, disposition, and searching
* Ability to meet with a circle of Elders already under contract with CSC to demonstrate their experience and knowledge

### **Terms and Conditions**

* The contract period is one year, from April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2024, with an option to extend for two additional one-year periods
* Estimated contract value, including options, is $261,000.00 (GST/HST extra)
* The supplier must comply with all security requirements, including holding a valid Reliability Status and complying with the Security Requirements Checklist

### **Procedure**

* Interested suppliers must submit a statement of capabilities to the contact person identified in this notice on or before March 10, 2023 at 2:00 PM EST
* The statement of capabilities must clearly demonstrate how the supplier meets the advertised requirements

### **Contact Information**

* Paulin, Manon
* Regional Officer, Contracting and Materiel Services, Correctional Service of Canada, 250 Montee Saint-François, Laval, QC H7C 1S5
* Telephone: 514-235-9156
* Email: [manon.paulin@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:manon.paulin@csc-scc.gc.ca)
